page.title: 13Halesowen Churches
page.content: We attend Our Lady and Saint Kenelm's Roman Catholic Primary School, the only one in Halesowen. It is about 20 years old and the present Catholic Church in Siviter Street is about the same age. St. John's Church of England Parish Church in the centre of Halesowen apparently stands on the site of an old Saxon church. The ruins of the 13th century Abbey built by Premonstratension monks and demolished by King Henry VIII are visible on the banks of the River Stour. Local landowner, Lord Cobham, has plans to hand over the church of St. Kenelm with its famous miraculous well, to Romsley Parish Church.
